Write a comprehensive project summary using ONLY the provided context. Ensure alignment with Humanitarian Response Plan priorities. If specific details are missing, generalize based on available info but do not hallucinate.

Specify and justify the project duration based on the provided timeframe. 1) For Rapid Response: Explain why 6 months is sufficient. 2) For Underfunded Emergencies: Explain how 9-12 months enables sustainable outcomes. Reference seasonal factors only if mentioned in context.

sections.section_name: Budget - Staff and Other Personnel Costs
sections.section_label: A. Staff and Other Personnel Costs
sections.instructions: Detail staffing requirements with: 1) Position titles and grades 2) Time allocations 3) Justification for each role 4) % charged to CERF. For <6% of direct costs, consolidate into one line item with rationale.
List required supplies with: 1) Item specifications 2) Quantities 3) Unit costs 4) Procurement method. For CERF, assume 100% coverage (mark % as n/a). Group similar items where appropriate.
Specify equipment needs with: 1) Item descriptions 2) Justification for each 3) Disposition plan post-project. For <2% of direct costs, consolidate into one line. Mark % as n/a for CERF.
Detail service contracts including: 1) Type of service 2) Provider qualifications 3) Deliverables 4) Payment schedule. Include cash transfer fees if applicable. Mark % as n/a for CERF.
Itemize travel costs with: 1) Purpose of each trip 2) Itineraries 3) Daily rates 4) Number of staff. For <1.5% of direct costs, consolidate. Mark % as n/a for CERF.

sections.section_name: Budget - Transfers and Grants to Counterparts
sections.section_label: F. Transfers and Grants to Counterparts
sections.instructions: List partner transfers including: 1) Organization names 2) Type (NNGO/INGO/Govt) 3) Amounts 4) Expected deliverables. Include capacity building components if relevant. Mark % as n/a for CERF.

sections.section_name: Budget - General Operating and Other Direct Costs
sections.section_label: G. General Operating and Other Direct Costs
sections.instructions: Specify operational costs ensuring: 1) Total ≤6.5% of budget 2) Clear justification for each item 3) Cost-efficiency measures. For <1.5% of direct costs, consolidate. Mark % as n/a for CERF.
Allocate the budget across sectors/clusters showing: 1) Percentage for each 2) Alignment with response priorities 3) Consistency with beneficiary targeting. Only complete for multi-sector projects.
Cross-reference budget allocations to key programming areas: 1) Protection 2) GBV 3) Gender 4) Disability 5) CVA. Ensure values match detailed budget sections.

Demonstrate localization by: 1) Listing local/national partners 2) Showing percentage of funds to local actors (target ≥25%) 3) Describing capacity building 4) Explaining community involvement in design. Use specific data and examples.

Explain protection mainstreaming by: 1) Identifying risks addressed 2) Describing mitigation measures across sectors 3) Linking to cluster standards 4) Showing staff capacity. Reference GPC guidelines.

Calculate protection-specific allocations by: 1) Sector 2) Percentage for targeted protection (exclude mainstreaming) 3) Dollar value 4) Beneficiary numbers. Enter 0 for sectors without targeted protection.
Explain the protection budgeting methodology: 1) Cost categories included 2) Assumptions made 3) Alignment with cluster standards 4) Verification methods. Be specific about calculation models.
